p: Ruta graveolens L., belonging to the Rutaceae family, is a medicinal plant widely used in the Mediterranean region to treat pain, dermatitis, rheumatism, and other inflammatory diseases. Pseudane IX ( 25), arborinine ( 26), and kokusaginine ( 27) were isolated from the leaves of Ruta angustifolia. Pseudane IX showed strong anti-HCV activity with an IC 50 value of 1.4 ± 0.2 μM without apparent cytotoxicity. The anti-HCV activity of pseudane IX was stronger than that of ribavirin (2.8 ± 0.4 μM), which has been widely used for the treatment of HCV infections. Mode-of-action analyses revealed that pseudane IX inhibited HCV at the post-entry step and decreased the levels of HCV RNA replication and viral protein synthesis. Compounds 26 and 27 also possessed moderate anti-HCV activity with IC 50 values of 6.4 ± 0.7 and 6.4 ± 1.6 μM, respectively. 40
